author: {'steamid': '76561198051910016', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1674245649}
review:
Now now I was one who badmouthed this game for being dead for years and to my surprise devs came back to it, which is great,

On to it: Art is wonderful, story is cool and combat is fluid for most part.
Now I got two main points regarding the later: 
-Constant chatter of the characters mid combat - combat here is not turn based and there are no voice overs, so it means combat stops in the middle of action for really lengthy conversations between MC and his AI. I love the flavor text you guys use however for combat information it is really long winded. Either give us a text only tutorial accessible anytime in the game or make info more on point and or only at the start of a battle.
-Don´t make us lose itens when we lose, just gives a straight game over like most games do. Or at least give us an option like "Normal mode - you just get a game over when you die" and "survivor mode - you lose your itens when you die and can try again". I mean it is not an easy system and being fast means we can also lose quickly and losing itens with that is really bad.

Basides those two points, loving the game thus far :3
-

review:
[h1] I don't recognize what this game turned into or was even trying to be, I just know that it was abandoned and that's probably for the best.  [/h1]


There is some kind of turn-based, lack of strategy happening here with no clear goals or combat system in place. It almost feels like a Megaman Battle Network game that was remade for the N-gage and then someone took those and ported it to mobile and then someone else saw that and tried to make a quick PC rip-off.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081274900', 'num_games_owned': 1305, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1499609714}
review:
In reponse to Auburok 's review below - if you think you're dissapointed because you've been waiting since 2012 for this game, try waiting since 2009! I've been tracking it since way back then and was so excited when it came up on Greenlight.
This game actually started out as a Java Nokia mobile game: 
http://www.pocketgamer.co.uk/r/Mobile/Crystalides/video.asp?c=42128
https://www.youtube.com/watch?time_continue=3&v=0q2bIoU8m2E
and then was meant to be converted to Android:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?time_continue=1&v=i_Qz8v4WndQ
and both of these versions looked far more exciting than what we've ended up with here in C-Wars. 
It looked so promising then ended up not finished and disapointing. Boo.

review: I was also a KS backer. Game is beyond broken. Very sad. The bones of it feel like it could have been fleshed out. Art still looks good, but there is no game to play here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031716185', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1441757702}
review:
Like many others have said, this game is so far removed from the tile-based, MM: Battle Network reboot that it originally promised to be back in 2012. I wanted to provide constructive critiscism upon playing the 2015 version of the Early Access launch but there was nothing I could give other than "Go back to the original Kickstarter demo format." 

With Kickstarter, there's a 50/50 chance the game you're backing could be like Shovel Knight, which became a surprise megalomanical hit or this, which slowly degenerated it's development over time and caused both the fans and the development team to give up on it. 

There's nothing I can really review about this game that hasn't been said. It's less tactical and more real time focused, a button-masher with confusing and sometimes difficult gameplay. The first demo from the kickstarter and subsequent demos were real-time tactical gameplay but were more rewarding to play based on the limited tile spaces, even with my obvious bugs. Not all games become like this, but that's the risk you take. I don't regret my decision in backing this, seeing as that was 5 years ago; I just want another MM: BattleNetwork game, someday.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013501772', 'num_games_owned': 987, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1495055026}
review:
It's really strange how all it went with this game.

I remember the alpha version, maybe I have it still in some forgotten "Downloads" folder somewhere on E drive. It was much more polished, much more FUN game than this one. It seems like C-wars had complete reboot sometime in 2014, for the worse.

Why, onipunks, whyyyyy?

I must admit that I found their KS pitch sympathetic, and the alpha was really promising. Still, it showed like many times before that from cool demo to full game you have to invest a lot of an effort.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043779298', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1457397398}
review:
As other reviews have stated, this game is nowhere near what was promised when the Kickstarter campaign started. I tried to give it the benefit of a doubt, playing the latest updates since its release. Even with that, the gameplay is just as lackluster with the updates as it was from release. Despite foregoing modern graphical fidelity in favor of a more retro cartoon/anime art style, it lacks any depth, style, soul or polish to make up for it. The end result is this mess of ideas that is poorly, POORLY executed. I would not recommend this game to anyone, as even the developers have seem to given up on the game.

Note: I was a campaign backer. Because of this game and Mighty No. 9, lesson learned: don't back video game starters.

Edit: I tried it out again to see if maybe there was something I was missing. I wasn't. Game is and was still trash.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001129731', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1461796160}
review:
tl;dr version first: this game is a waste of time.

The tutorial is ridiculous and has too much in-universe fluff.  I don't mine Rogue-Likes if there's a point to it.  This game is quite pointless, however, as the difficulty in missions make no sense early on.  There's no real way to earn any progress, the store where you're supposed to upgrade your units is broken, and there are far too many glitches to count.  At one point, my character got stuck in the far-right, bottom of the screen and is completely unable to do anything.  Meanwhile, this zombie with a machine gun, dressed up as a police officer, has decimated my entire team.  But there's nothing that I can do except to go back to the Title.  The lack of in-game manual is substituted by hitting the "Tab" key to get some vague explanations about features that you can't even use.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098713445', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1455210261}
review:
已经过去1年多了，想起来这个游戏，又玩了玩，果然还是一坨屎...

本人用的MACBOOK玩的这个游戏，表示不知道是不是OS系统天生不适合玩游戏的原因，游戏里把键盘拍烂了都打不开所谓的商店，而且每次玩完退出之后想要再次运行steam立马就嗝屁了...只能强制退出...搞不明白，回头买个手柄看看能不能解决问题吧


追加 2016 Feb 11： 另外这个游戏在steam安装时显示要占用我2200MB的内存，然而游戏本身只有60mb的大小，就算是为了后期更新余留了空间是不是也太夸张了点？ 更新完毕之后游戏可以用shift打开商店，目前没有任何问题，但是我只要一将召唤兵带入战斗，整个游戏就出现问题，表现情况为：人物可以移动，但是攻击时攻击动画和音效明显鬼畜，并且敌人受到攻击后会保持硬直状态不断飙血并无法杀死敌人。 目前只碰到过3次，但是都是使用召唤兵之后的第一次战斗出现问题。

期待进一步的更新修复。

author: {'steamid': '76561197970724214', 'num_games_owned': 1519, 'num_reviews': 188, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1454225286}
review:
Early backer here. Backed on Kickstarter based on the pitch in the middle of 2013. Played the alphas, liked where it was going. Seriously, look at the difference:

https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1054244612/c-wars-roguelike-pixel-art-pc-game/description

Tons of radio silence throughout this, of course. There was limited mention about why things were taking so long, what was going on with the team, etc. Eventually I just forgot about it.

Then, suddenly, they went to Early Access. Man, was I excited - I thought the alpha must have progressed enough to warrant releasing it on Steam! But... alas... it wasn't the same game pitched at all. It didn't feel the same, the battlefields weren't structured the same way, my dreams of playing this on a touch interface were basically shattered.

What happened? Everyone, including the dev, said to give it time. Fair enough. So, after August 20th, 2015, I waited. I figured, well, if things need to be overhauled, that'll take a few months, right? Three? Why stop there? Let's wait 5, just to give it extra time.

Man, what a let down. I know it's early access still, but this game's two years past the original deadline. It feels like a flash game, it runs like a flash game. 

Activating the "grid" to see movement literally puts hex outlines in a checkerboard pattern on a square grid, and the player can only move in the four cardinal directions. The controls for keyboard are rather poor. The best part of the game, the animations, are choppy and have a limited amount of frames each (it's like they were animated on fours rather than twos or ones) and the sprites themselves are low detail. It's hard to get into the game when it's so clunky, but the majority of it seems to be moving from battle to battle with little to do inbetween. The combat itself is tedious to the point that I'd rather just go do chores.

I can't recommend this game. I'll probably let it sit in my library until it's out of early access (if that happens), but it's on my "remove from account without refund because it's that bad" list.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964584830', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1462210137}

author: {'steamid': '76561198215794560', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1484353473}
review: I am really torn about this game? And here are the reasons why... I saw it about half a year ago. It was supposed to be a downloadable release on xbox 1 maybe 360... anyway, the sprites and enemies were the same however the background has drastically been changed from a lucius HD platform to a pixelated pile of dog doo doo. I understand that this is a early access game or whatever but I purchased it on sale for half price and it still isnt worth any money. Its an unfinished demo, not even, a taste of what the game might be like if it ever comes full circle. Which it prob. wont. Dont miss understand, I really like where the game is going, and I hope it gets finished, but I cant help but feel that some of these smaller game developers are slowly watching their dream slip between their fingers so they throw whatever they can at the community to scrounge whatever money they can out of the "burnt-out" project their shoveling on real fans. Games like Mighty No. 9, CHASM, games I want more then anything to be realized, to become lies and trickery. This game has been around way to long to not be finished by now. God, I hope these ICs prove me wrong, but I'm not gonna hold my breath and you my friend shouldnt waste your money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041553585', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1447998695}
review:
Disclaimer: I'm a kickstarter backer so the low play time count on Steam does not reflect  actual game time since I have been playing the alpha builds released prior to Steam. 

TLDR Game Description: Are you aware of the megaman exe series before? If you are, this plays a lot like it, if you aren't the units here move in real time along a grid, and you move on the grid to dodge enemy attacks and launch your own attacks. The game mechanics are extremely addicting as it is reflex and tactically based, there are lots of times you can die but you will want to retry it. 

Yeah so, just a background C-Wars was actually a game pitched in kickstarter more than 2 years ago, the dev team underwent severe issues both personally and financially and as a result the game spent time in development hell and entered early access by the skin of its teeth...this is the reason why the game has a lot of negative reviews when it was first launched it was really closer to a tech demo than an actual game. 

FORTUNATELY, the dev team went into super saiyan mode and started releasing daily updates since then, right now I can say it can be positively compared to other EA games in terms of actual content, and consequently is now worth the EA price. For the price of a cup of coffee you get beautiful pixel art, ok music and fun and frenetic gameplay. I suggest you buy it now because the price will likely increase. 

I mean at the end of the day the game is receiving daily updates, patches, bug fixes and various quality of life improvements so it will definitely be worth your purchase. Buy it now and encourage them to improve the game even more. Plus, it is highly original this is the first megaman exe style game I've seen anywhere apart from the original megaman exe games themselves.

author: {'steamid': '76561198246500732', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1447930534}

author: {'steamid': '76561198214878375', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1447924061}
review: 现在很多独立游戏都是画风诡异风格乖戾似乎是学的禅意但在下却认为是舍本逐末了。区区拙见：关卡设计和打击感和操作手感才是真正见功夫的。水晶战争在下用的是360手柄体验 感觉相当成熟可以给85分。

author: {'steamid': '76561198035781607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1447952017}
review:
Fun game.  Pain in the ass, but you have to play smart, time your attacks right, and ration your weapons properly.  You find companions and start with a few throw-away bots.  

I suggest one playthrough with the tutorial before trying out impossible missions.  You'll get hella frustrated otherwise.

Also don't keep playing missions that are killing you.  The more times you attempt the less time/more critical the situation with the mutants gets. (100 percent ends the game)

Work in progress, for sure, but as it stands is well worth the money and support!

author: {'steamid': '76561198256337545', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1445595364}
review:
Amazing pixel graphics, buffets drop by zombies and frequent updates. That's my impression of this game so far.

It plays like a STG game on a gridded battlefield but also has a lots of ACT flavor. Might not be everyone's cup of tea, but I found it fun, challenging and inspiring.

It's obviously still under development. There're improvements to be done and contents to be filled. But it's a good game in general and got some real potential. I mean, there're not too many games on early access that let you hold an actual idea about what the dev teams are doing. But not for this one. They are updating the game like non stop.

Verdict, buy it if you want to support this promising game while it is still cheap.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069994429', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1441972842}
review:
What the hell happened to this game? When I backed the game on Kickstarter years ago, it actually had some interesting gameplay: tile-based strategy, items, multiple characters... That's all gone now. What's left is... a repetitive, unbalanced, and uninspired button-mashing action game.

This is the first game that after years of work has actually gotten much less developed than when it started! It's sad. I don't know where they're going, but it doesn't seem like a good place. Maybe they plan to someday add all the interesting features back into the game, but for the moment stay away.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010141945', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1441963101}
review:
Opening caveat: I am a kickstarter backer of the game, and received this copy as a result of that

A lot of reviews comment on the fact that you're not getting a lot for your money. There's hardly any content, and it's incredibly buggy. These reviews were posted within the first day or two of release, and do not reflect the current stage of the game right now. This is, after all, an early access game. Oni-punks have been releasing near-daily updates, adding content and tweaking bugs since release. Is this a finished product? Not hardly. But what it IS is a taste of what the final game will entail. 

You have a grid, you move on the grid, you attack your enemies. Conserve your ammo, choose your targets, and time your attacks properly to avoid reprisal. There are three characters, each with unique weapons and abilities. Each has a set of stages through which they must pass, along with optional side missions. Since that first release, bugs have been fixed, the stages have been improved and organized better, and the game in general just feels better as well. As I said, it's still more of a demo than anything, but it's growing steadily.

In time, you will have helper characters, along with a wider variety of heroes and weapons from which to choose. Sure, it's been a long time coming, but it's heartening to see these basic building blocks, to know that the game DOES exist. As long as the flow of updates continues to be as rapid as it has been, I, for one, will continue to recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040825571', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1440808192}
review:
[b]This early access release is actually worse than the alpha releases that came out before steam availability.[/b] 

What you currently see, the title screen, 3 barely playable heroes in a few stages with only a couple of finished enemy sprites has been in development since early 2013. This is all a full 2 years+ of dev time shows. Add to it the fact that they had spent 3 years prior to work on the engine itself. Speaking of the engine -

[quote] "Our self-developed engine ensures better performance. Small reminder: ONI-engine packed 800+ pixel animations into 1Megabyte, about half the size of a photo taken with your phone." [/quote]

That was scrapped, the entire game is now based in unity. Originally the animation and engine looked great the artists had ton tons of sprites and animation of high quality. Late 2014 Oni dissolved it's team. While the Founding dev nsisted it was due to [i]"fame and discipline"[/i] the press at chuapp (a Chinese news blog) was able to contact former team members who stated (loosely translated)

[quote=devteam]"two reasons: Project outlook is bleak and unbearable leader character."[/quote]

Leaving only it's founding developer to direct, program, [strike](possibly animate as well since the sprites have gotten worse)[/strike] and market the game. The development remained stagnant for months. Currently the founder has hired a minimal team and had this to say about development

[quote=founder]"Well we don't have the manpower or time or willing to add anything else into the game which is not related to the game itself." (Extra content, proper DRM, etc) "We have barely enough people to finish the game."[/quote]

AVOID AT ALL COSTS. This game is not worth your money. It is not feature rich, it is hardly playable, and it shows no promise of ever getting better.[b]This game has managed to get worse in gameplay/features and animation since original pre-steam release.[/b].

author: {'steamid': '76561198043271642', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1676175406}
review:
Edit: 6/16/2016
Don't buy, 
I defended this.thought they had a framework and was just going to add content over time and
I must say by adding content for a while, it was items in game, there wasn't enough content to justify the price, oh yes today we got a cake, tomorrow we got eggrolls, Fantastic content, while there was a few characters added, it seems like alot was taken away from their orginal Concept while I thought it was the upgrade from flash to unity that changed this, Apparently it wasn't
So they threw out alot of their kickstarter animations , characters, I didn't mind the whole level redesigns, again I thought it was going to be bigger and better, so no updates since march of last year, tottally diffrent from kickstarter, while they didn't tell anyone about the redesigns when it came to EA, to now where they commented on this review "We'll continue to work hard to fill up the content and be entirely reachable for feedback and suggestions." can be taken as a false
Just like my hopes for this game
Orignal short review for refrence, I deleted the long ranty review
C-wars
A Tatical Rouge-lite Arpg, that takes place on grid based battles using items and units
while controling your hero in real time, dodging and attacking with satasfying pixel animations
TD:LR
Very early game devolpment, its framework is already set and content is going to be rolled in constantly , so for seven dollars your getting a promised Random generated Tatical Arpg Rouge lite game that will last you 45 minutes a play through, as its quick , Brutal, and always a new game due to the Rouge-like format of the game, with some amazing pixel animations and music

author: {'steamid': '76561198246039478', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1440210840}
review:
Backed this game a while ago and received the free key. Not a fan of Steam, but find this Early Access thing pretty interesting.

Love the pixel art style and animation. But the game is truly in need for more contents. Looking forward to the auto-generated missions and equipment system!

I don't see the point for trolling and ranting can help them make good product. And this team seems working hard on nailling harsh situations for now.

Anyway, that's what I think. Here's my thumb up and hope for a better game for now. 

Don't keep us waiting this time!

谢谢 and 加油!

author: {'steamid': '76561198090032286', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1537289041}
review:
等待了这么久终于出来了！从这款游戏在Kickstarter上发动筹资开始就万分期待。
迫不及待上手试玩起来！
总体来说游戏的战斗体验相当不错，目前的三个角色似乎对应了由简单到困难三种不同的难度。
并且三个角色都配置了自己独特的故事和玩法。因为武器的配置不同，就迫使玩家要在不同的角色身上找出不同的攻击手段，同时要根据实际情况进行迅速的判断来躲闪敌人的攻击。可谓策略和直觉并存的新颖的战斗方式！值得体验！！

关于游戏的不足当然也有：
游戏的UI反馈做的不是很到位，确定与退出并没有合适的音效来提示玩家，这点细节学弱了菜单以及关卡选择的体验，希望修改。

强烈期待游戏的后续发展！！
加油！！！

author: {'steamid': '76561198000692477', 'num_games_owned': 688, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1440107479}
review: This game started out as a lane based Action RPG/Strategy Roguelike, and has, over an extra 21 months over the deadline, become the barest bones Action RPG with zero roguelike or strategy elements. The music and animations are fantastic, but everything else is a huge letdown.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992724165', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1440022545}
review:
Kickstarted that game LONG ago, looked promising with some kind of strategy in real time, involving a hero with support troop battling enemies. 

What we got is a strange action game where you spam buttons, every enemy move in a chaotic way and you have some bullets, but not much strategy involved... In fact, you empty both your guns, you use your grenades, then usually some enemies are still alive. The key then? Melee them going on their square... They'll catch in fire and you can just spam the attack until they die. You either win in 30 seconds or lose in 10-20 seconds. And every mission look the same.

It really feels like a game made by 1 or 2 persons in their house in their spare time. I know it's early access, but with a delivery date that was stated for October 2013, it's nowhere near a good game.

If they don't do major fixes, don't buy this game, it's not worth it. I've kickstarted other games that did deliver what they promised in general (Massive Chalice, Darkest Dungeon, Battle World Kronos) in time and I think this game is going nowhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969010414', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1440087837}
review:
Wow has this game changed.
When I first kickstarted this it looked like really interesting, tacticle grid based combat.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rnhri78Y2uA

Then, when the beta came out there were changes (of course) but still had this feel. Multiple weapons, massive enemy swarms, summoning aid to cover you.

Then this unplayable mess is released and is nothing like what I backed. Suddenly I'm fighting maybe 5 enemies with only 1 reload on my gun. My only attack, once I was out of ammo, was a low damage kick that used stamina. Stamina regens VERY VERY VERY slowly AND only if you are standing still.
Maybe that's only a problem with the character I chose (the blue guy, forgot his name), but it was such a bad experience why would I try the others.

Honestly, if I could, I would ask for my pledge back at this point.

author: {'steamid': '76561198213559987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1440854896}
review:
C'est hyper marrant d'y jouer!! C'est pas cher, genre, du tout, alors, si tu aime pixel art, prends ça. Je suis certain que ca va bien avancer. Hier, les developpeurs ont ajoute les tutorials, ca marche vachement mieux maintenant. 

On ne voit pas 3 jeux en pixel arrivent tous les matins. C'est rare en voyant un jeu de si haute qualité s'apparait comme une fleur. Honnêtement, ça vaut le cout.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040829435', 'num_games_owned': 249, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1441305116}
review:
To preface this review, this is based on the Early Access version I was provided from the Kickstarter I had back almost 2 years ago. With that being said, let me be perfectly clear: This is not a game. This is essentially a limited demo with pretty much an hour worth of content. Due to the incredibly unfinished condition of this "game", I cannot recommend it to anyone. 

When it comes the game itself, what it provides it decent enough. Three separate characters, each with their own missions (although they barely vary) and they all control pretty differently. 

EDIT 8/20/15: They now have a prompt that shows the control scheme, which alleviates some of the issue of not knowing what's going on.

That's not nearly enough to understand what's going on with multiple weapon types, ammo counts to manage different ranges for each and much more. You end up fumbling around until you somehow find the magic attack that is strong against the particular enemy type. Gameplay aside, there is practically nothing left. No story, no customization, very limted sound and music. 

After waiting two years after plunking down cash on this project, I am horrifically disappointed that this is all they've had to show. I pray they are able to crank out updates on a regular basis to flesh out what is essentially 99% of the remaining content. If they can release an actual game soon and not a paid and shallow demo, then you should look into this. As for now though, stay far away.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028620280', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1439985182}
review:
At this point this "game" isn't worth the price.
All you get are 3 Characters, who get no introduction, you just select them in one of the worst select screens I have ever seen and are just thrown into the game...
And now you are stuck with this character, because the only way to get back to the select screen, is when you beat all available missions with that character. Which is near impossible with those controls. 
Your character is moving on a invisible grid and can only move one space at a time and when you are finally close enough to hit an enemy, he will just dodge it because the attack animations are too long. 
Take the gun, pose a bit, aim straight forward, shoot and put the gun back to where ever you've got it from. 
I see what they are trying to do, (I guess) they want to have a mix of real time and turn based combat, but that is one of the worst attempts to do so, that I have seen yet.
Oh and did I mention that you can't exit the game. 
I've tried every damn key on my keyboard and the only ones that worked were Ctrl+Alt+Del.
I know that Early Access Games are kind of just a preview of the finished product, but you got to have more than that.
Your problem probably is, that you focused too much on the pixel art (which is beautiful btw), but stunning visuals can't make up for horrible gameplay.

If you want to support the devs, buy it. But if you are just interested in the game, wait until it has more content.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008261725', 'num_games_owned': 5740, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1455305218}
review:
As it stands, this is barely a game, and is certainly nonfunctional. There are no indications as to what the controls are, or what you are trying to achieve within the game. There is no explanation of what the game's system actually are. This is, at best, a tech demo that will frustrate you.

Sure, it's pretty to look at, but this isn't a slideshow, it's a game, and in that respect, it's leaves you holding the bag.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977524460', 'num_games_owned': 4114, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1680890234}
review:
This is a great pixel style zombie survival game.

The goal in this game is quite simple, collect money, upgrade and buy ammo, trying to get to the next level and enjor the fun!
Even right now its early accesss version but I can still see the potential of this game.

Great design, great music, however, still a long way to go!

author: {'steamid': '76561198002627508', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 431, 'last_played': 1637596777}
review:
I don't like long review, let's make it short: (A) I'm a backer of this game  (B) I like it. 

Good: 
* Daily update since the initial earlyaccess release
* Gorgeous pixel art
* Sci-Fi action game & Tower defense
* Looks like Megaman battle network
* Gain your XP by eating bread and worms

Bad
* [strike]I could use a jill sandwich but [/strike] I don't like bread..

To be honest, the current gameplay is straight forward enough: Realtime combat; Tower Defense element; Control your hero and make combo; Try to survive as long as you can in different missions, and, it looks like Megaman battle network, seriously! 

For a humble price like this, $7, plus at least 2 hours play time and replayability, people are still complaining? With the free backer keys on top of that? Really? 

Sure there are  stuff need to be added. The game needs a final touch too, but, it could be a great game. Plus, I can see there are more coming, like story, store, item management and stuff. That's why it's still a early access product isn't it?

I am a backer of this project myself although I backed it thru paypal not ks but I still love their KS video which is pretty funny. 2 years ago, honestly, I only backed the project because of these fancy animations.

Now? It's more like my type of game.

That's my 2 cents.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985036092', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 292, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1439551283}
review:
Early days, still plenty of promise. 3 available characters who all have different skills and quests available. Missions basically played like real-time chess, characters move on squares while a bunch of enemies spawn that you take down using abilities, 1-use items and anything else that goes boom. Levels didn't seem to be randomly generated as suggested, not sure if that's a bug or WIP. Gamepad and mouse controls were available but only keyboard worked for me. Asking price is fair given the current content and with everything said, if a fan of tactics, pixel art and anime it's worth at least keeping on your radar.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x59gVKuWhmc

author: {'steamid': '76561198001748570', 'num_games_owned': 1496, 'num_reviews': 179, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1439832849}
review:
For this cheap of a price, this game is freaking fantastic. I love it!

Beautiful pixel anime graphics, great unique real-time action combat in a block-based battlefield system. There's a bunch of characters to choose (3 at the moment), more to come I'd presume, all with their own unique weapons an play style and missions. Same with the enemies, there's a handfull of them with their own unique attacks to tackle.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jYAOt-G19EE

At first I was confused with the game's combat when I looked at the trailer, was it turn-based combat or real-time? Turns out it was the latter but placed in a block-based battlefield system.

You can't say no to this game for that price. Althought it would be great to have mouse controls, please devs? =)

Just to counter the cons people are saying about the game:

-"certainly nonfunctional"
= it's functional and working just fine.

-"There are no indications as to what the controls are, or what you are trying to achieve within the game."
= there is indications of what the controls are, and what your objective is in the game.

-"There is no explanation of what the game's system actually are."
= Yes there is, which is the controls description

author: {'steamid': '76561198075596908', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1468993976}
review: 战斗模式类似洛克人EXE，属于我喜欢的那种，让人眼前一亮。但是有个问题，就是不能向左攻击，虽然问题不是特别大，还有就是目前要素较少，战斗重复率比较高。小体型角色和敌人重叠后=无敌，希望改进不过 总来的说 非常值得期待完成品

author: {'steamid': '76561198107987341', 'num_games_owned': 406, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1640848476}
review:
首先恭喜游戏终于发售了，第一时间就入了
我是从cwar KS众筹成功后才开始关注这款游戏的
